text: In addition, you know what Joab, son of Zeruiah, did to me and what he did to Abner, son of Ner, and Amasa, son of Jether, the two army commanders of Israel. He murdered them, spilling the blood of war during a time of peace. He smeared the blood of war on his belt and on his sandals.2:5. Thought by some to be a symbolic act that showed the complete destruction of the victim, ending his movement and his ability to father children.
